title: Basque Country (greater region)
summary: The Basque Country (Basque: Euskal Herria; Spanish: Pa√≠s Vasco; French: Pays basque) is the name given to the home of the Basque people.[1] The Basque country is located in the western Pyrenees, straddling the border between France and Spain on the coast of the Bay of Biscay. Euskal Herria is the oldest documented Basque name for the area they inhabit, dating from the 16th century.[2]
